results.title: Software Quality Assurance (QA) Engineer
results.description:
Company Summary:
Anderson Optimization (AO) is a leading software as a service (SaaS) provider in the renewable energy development industry. We work with top solar, wind, and battery developers across the US and abroad to efficiently bring more renewable energy onto the power grid. We are scaling rapidly and need talent to support this growth. Our culture is autonomous with a heavy emphasis on work/life balance.

 

Position Summary:

Our company is looking to hire a mid level Software Quality Assurance Engineer to help with our testing efforts. This role will support all aspects of testing from manual testing, documentation, and automation as we continue to build out or testing suite.
This role will provide the opportunity to be a major part of a growing development team, as well as the chance to have a huge impact in the renewable energy industry.

 

Requirements

Duties will include:

  • Work cross-collaboratively with the software development team and other departments to establish quality throughout the software development process.
  • Review requirements, specifications, and technical design documents to create test cases.
  • Identify, record, and document bugs.
  • Assist with the development and implementation of automated tests.
  • Maintain a solid understanding of QA workflows and test automation best practices.
  • Promote a culture of quality within our development team, as well as the company.
  • Collaborate within the QA team to determine best testing practices.

 

Desired Qualifications:

  • 3+ years experience creating and executing test cases on a manual testing team
  • Experience with frontend test automation technologies – preferably Cypress
  • Experience with creating/maintaining backend test collections of APIs utilizing postman, swagger, fiddler, or other tools

Benefits

  • This role has a minimum base salary of $70,000. Actual salary offered will take into consideration years of experience, experience in industry, and relevant skill set.
  • 401(K) + 4% Match
  • Health insurance reimbursement
  • No vacation limit, minimum 3 weeks
  • Half day summer Fridays
  • Work from anywhere / 100% remote (office available in Boulder, CO if you prefer working onsite).

results.title: Manual QA Engineer
results.description:
Bitsgap is a public crypto trading platform with trading bots and algorithmic orders. The company has been on the market since 2017 and is among the top 3 crypto exchange aggregators. More than 500,000 beginners and professional traders have used our technologies.

We are looking for an experienced Head of the affiliate team who can offer an affiliate program at a new level. You have to manage a team of 5-7 people, monitor metrics, look for new procurement channels and analyze old ones. You must have systems thinking, and a deep understanding of marketing and sales.

 

What is to be done?

  • Manage the Affiliate department.
  • Attract new partners and work with current ones.
  • Handle incoming traffic.
  • Explain the advantages of the platform and convince them to put our project above competitors in the lists.
  • Analyze projects in order to accurately understand our advantages.
  • Maintain correspondence with a large number of partners.
  • Resolve issues that arise with partners.
  • Find new opportunities for the development of the affiliate program.
  • Negotiate the publication of links, articles, and press releases.
  • Take proactive action to achieve goals.
  • Track the effectiveness of your own actions.


What we expect from you

  • Experience as an affiliate manager or head of an affiliate program for at least 3 years.
  • At least one year of experience in the crypto or forex trading industry.
  • Continuous sales training and increase your own efficiency.
  • With Digital marketing, you are on “you”, you know how it should be and can implement it.
  • Communication and persuasion skills.
  • Experience with SAAS (Software as a Service) will be a significant plus
  • Competent and concise writing.
  • Understanding user conversion.
  • Must understand the terms conversion, affiliate marketing, CPA, cookies, affiliate programs, tracking, and do-follow links.
  • Ability to analyze the work of the department and the ability to manage personnel.
  • Knowledge and tracking of current trends and market.
  • Knowledge of English from confident B2 to C2.
  • High communication and organization skills.

 

We offer:

  • Work from anywhere in the world in a great team.
  • The opportunity to implement your ideas in a dynamically developing project.
  • Participation in creating a high-value product, the purpose of which is to benefit customers.
  • Fixed salary at the end of each month.
  • 21 days of paid vacation.
  • Paid sick leave.
  • Compensation for training courses and webinars.

 

Do you see yourself in this position?

  • Apply for a job.
  • Write a cover letter in English explaining why we should choose you.

 

P.S.: If your resume meets our expectations, we'll ask you to go through the following stages:

  • initial interview with our HR Manager (about 20 minutes);
  • interview with the CEO and the HR BP (approximately 1 hour);
  • a test assignment.

We invite you to join our team if you successfully pass all stages.

results.title: Quality Assurance Lead
results.description:
Norima, a Winnipeg-based technology consulting company that prides itself on its ability to deliver results in the most complex and challenging business environments, is in need of an experienced Quality Assurance Analyst Lead with functional and technical expertise to lead one of our key delivery teams.

*This role will be remote*

Job Description

We are looking for candidates with exemplary character, consistency and competence to join a growing team of professionals who share a passion for solving complex problems with technology-based solutions. Ideally you have:

  • Completed a university degree or college diploma
  • A minimum of five (5) to eight (8) years of proven work experience in software testing
  • Experience leading a team in test planning delivery, preparation and activities relating to execution
  • Experience designing and executing clear and effective test plans ensuring for accuracy and completeness against business requirements
  • Experience working with developers to troubleshoot and resolve defects
  • Experience writing test scripts to test applications against underlying data or third-party systems/tools
  • Impeccable attention to detail
  • Exceptional communication and problem-solving skills
  • Knowledge and experience in the ISTQB body of knowledge

Overall Qualifications

Norima is a fast-paced, entrepreneurial company, looking to hire the best, brightest, and hardest working consultants onto our high-calibre team. As the ideal candidate, you:

  • Are client delivery focused, and committed to working as a flexible extension to our clients to earn a place as their trusted advisor
  • Possess superior written and verbal communication skills
  • Have a natural curiosity towards gaining new understanding and broadening your knowledge base
  • Are skilled in managing and prioritizing multiple projects and competing deadlines
  • Have strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Additional Technical Requirements

  • Execute manual and technical test strategies, plans and procedures
  • Document results to ensure all applications developed meet quality standards
  • Analyze, design, and develop manual and technical test strategies, plans and procedures
  • Document and investigate software problems, and liaise with software developers to solve problems
  • Ability to provide guidance to others regarding testing best practices
  • Experience using testing tools, such as JIRA, Rally, Quality Centre, etc.
  • Experience with automated testing tools an asset, such as Soap UI or Selenium
  • Experience in agile and waterfall testing environments
  • Knowledge of SQL or database testing an asset.

Why Norima?

For over 10 years, Norima Consulting Inc. has been transforming businesses by leveraging the right technology, at the right time, by, and in collaboration with, the right people. Norima has been consistently growing in both size and revenue for over a decade, almost exclusively by word of mouth, and this has only been possible by ensuring that we have been an employer of choice for top professionals who are passionate about demonstrating real results and committed to achieving excellence.

Norima works hard to provide a collaborative, rewarding environment and work opportunities that attract and retain top candidates and employees. Norima's Learning and Growth strategy is to actively invest in professional development and to provide opportunity for progressive work assignments to build experience. Norima is a place where professional growth is actively supported and expected.

According to independent employee reviews on Glassdoor.com, 100% would recommend Norima to a friend, and 100% approve of the CEO. Norima has a summary score of 4.9 stars out of 5.0.

We offer competitive compensation and benefits, an RRSP matching program, a professional development program, and a positive work environment. This is a great opportunity to be at the heart of a growing company.

results.title: Mid-Level Penetration Tester - US
results.description:
OccamSec is a leading provider in the world of cybersecurity. Our clients rely on us to provide information security services that exceed current industry standards. We provide accurate, actionable information to reduce risk and enable better informed decisions. Our unique end-to-end solutions detect, identify, respond, and protect in order to maximize the effectiveness of our clients' security programs.

We are looking for security-focused penetration testers with two - three years of professional experience to join our team. Job duties will include penetration testing, security analysis, security architecture and design, and research into current technologies and attacks.

Responsibilities

  • A Penetration Tester must have (or develop) the experience, technical skill, consulting finesse, and management skills required to deliver a broad variety of technically demanding projects, including network penetration test, web application assessments, threat hunting, and more.
  • Depending on level, consultants may be expected to act as technical leads on projects and focus on developing skills needed to continue delivering high-quality projects, help colleagues at OccamSec through the act of mentoring, and exhibit technical prowess via research and tool development.
  • Some travel may be required, although much of our work can be delivered remotely. We also monitor travel so that no one spends too much time on the road – our goal is to ensure that no one gets burnt out.

Desired Experience / Skills

  • At least two - three years of professional experience in this role required;
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States;
  • Web application and web service testing;
  • Network infrastructure penetration testing;
  • Mobile application security testing (Android and iOS);
  • Able to perform security-focused code review in 2+ programming languages;
  • Familiarity with secure configuration of Windows, Linux, and MacOS systems;
  • Familiar with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud Platform;
  • Familiar with OS internals, virtualization, or container technologies;
  • Able to guide clients through secure design methodologies such as threat modeling and attack surface enumeration;
  • Knowledge of hardware and embedded system security;
  • Familiarity with cryptography;
  • Detailed knowledge of bootloaders, operating systems, and drivers; and
  • Ability to perform black-box reverse engineering.

Personal Qualities

  • Excellent spoken and written communication skills;
  • High level of professionalism;
  • Outstanding attention to detail;
  • Self-motivated and a demonstrated self-started;
  • Highly Dependable; and
  • Willingness to travel.

Benefits

  • Flexible working hours;
  • Competitive health packages;
  • Life insurance;
  • 401k plan with company contributions;
  • Maternity and parental leave;
  • On-the-job training opportunities; and
  • Paid, flexible vacation.

results.title: Software Engineer In Test
results.description:
Who are we?

We are a venture-backed startup founded by ex-Googler data enthusiasts and built by talented people all over the world. Our mission is to fix the internet with effective user experiences that leverage AI.

We enable commerce websites to increase their effectiveness through AI driven user experiences. Every company should be able to provide Amazon, Netflix, and TikTok level effectiveness without a massive AI team. Our customers love us because we increase their revenue with little effort and they don’t pay unless we deliver results.

The company raised $5 million from big_bets, RTP Global, and Angel Invest, with participation from Matthew Freud and the founders of digital commerce platform VTEX.

Why Join Us?

We are just about to enter a growth phase in the business which means we’re aggressively increasing our headcounts primarily across engineering and AI departments. The team size is about 40 people. You’ll work in close conjunction with the founding leadership - CTO and CEO, VP infrastructure, data science, and machine learning leaders.

Remote all the way

Forget the commute, work from anywhere in the world with other amazing people, enjoy getting together in person in beautiful places like our last get-together in Rio De Janeiro.

Who are you?

You have leadership skills and like to understand and work closely with the business, are curious, skeptical, humble, and ambitious at the same time. You believe the ultimate way to prove a solution is with Data.

When interfacing with a business you summarize possible outcomes and options, their strengths and weaknesses. Nobody can predict the future. Seeing and articulating some of the possible paths is what you do well.

The Role

We have a very exciting opportunity for an experienced Software Engineer in Test to take the Lead Role in our Automation Strategy and Implementation.

This is a pivotal role that genuinely offers an exciting opportunity to focus on taking the Test Automation Framework to the next level, make strategic decisions, think critically and most importantly get things done.

Responsibilities

  • Design, implement and maintain an Automation Test Strategy
  • Design, plan, implement, and automate test plans along with the engineering team.
  • Use and enhance the Testing Frameworks for both API and UI type tests, to write Automation Tests and integrate with existing CI/CD tools.
  • Use standard best practices with an eye on extensibility, performance and organized & documented in a clear and understandable way for ease of maintenance.
  • Collaborate closely with QA, Engineering, and Product Teams to understand the priority of Automation and Coverage required
  • Work with the QA and Dev team to upskill people to write & maintain Automation Scripts
  • Maintenance and Analysis of tests – build a Test Results Dashboard for easy results evaluation
  • Follow the shift left philosophy – so that the majority of our testing effort is early and at the lower end of the Testing Pyramid (I.e. Dev/CI/CD)
  • Configure and maintain test environments & test data
  • Participate in troubleshooting and triaging of issues with different teams to drive towards root cause identification and resolution

Requirements

  • 5+ years experience with test plan/test case authoring, developing automated tests and creating defect tickets when issues are found.
  • Proven experience in Setting up and writing UI/API tests
  • Understand CI/CD Principles
  • Understands web development principles and well versed in the request-response cycle.
  • Experience testing web-based applications.
  • Understands Unit, Integration and E2E testing principles.
  • Experience in devising, managing and implementing effective testing strategies
  • Strong experience with typical Automation Languages using TypeScript/JavaScript
  • 4+ years experience with Selenium, Cypress, or equivalent
  • Familiarity with Agile software development methodologies & tools
  • Knowledge of distributed version control systems such as Git

Personal traits

  • Self-motivated and can work autonomously
  • Can think strategically and critically
  • Plans and develops code independently with minimal guidance keeping all the relevant stakeholders informed about status and progress.
  • Genuine interest in Quality Assurance and learning the Product under test
  • Passionate and demonstrates ownership of deliverables for timely releases
  • Ability to not just implement but also document, train and upskill others
  • Resourcefulness and troubleshooting aptitude
  • Interested in learning new tools & processes and rolling it out to others

Benefits

Unlimited Vacation, Flexible Working Hours, Competitive Salary, Stock Options, Benefits.

FAQ

Who are our founders?

Co-founder and CEO - Peter Szalontay

Co-founder and CTO - Cristiano Carvalho

Co-founder - Misha Lyalin

Is there a probation and how long does it last? - There is no concept of probation.

What is the work schedule? – There’s a completely asynchronous working environment. Exceptions: meetings that are agreed by the individuals or at the team level that are necessary.

Is it possible to work remotely? - Yes, We are a remote first company.

Number of vacation days, sick days? – Unlimited. We only require your success.

Is there a prospect of business trips, and where? – We have company offsites on an annual/semi-annual basis where we meet up in a beautiful location.

Social package (medical insurance, other)? – We discuss it individually.

results.title: Senior Frontend & QA Engineer
results.description:
Senior Frontend & QA Engineer - Remote
 
Premia is a decentralized options platform connecting traders and liquidity providers of all backgrounds. Offering non-custodial options to hedge, speculate, or earn yield on your digital assets.  Premia offers first of its kind automated market maker solutions in the DeFi space for Options Contracts through our use of Smart Liquidity Pools and Dynamic Pricing.  Premia enables best-in-class pricing based on market volatility, providing fully-featured peer-to-pool trading and capital efficiency to DeFi options.
 
We are one of the smallest and most impactful teams in crypto. We are a globally distributed organization, with all positions being fully remote.
 
We’re looking for a passionate, self-motivated engineer to help us build the next generation of financial products. As a dedicated Engineering hire, you will gain ownership over our existing suite of web products, as well as the ability to influence the creation, design, and execution of future products. You will be responsible for ensuring a consistent, high-quality user experience across trading interfaces, data-heavy analytics pages, documentation portals, subgraph on The Graph and more.
 
Who are you?
 
A senior-level front-end engineer (JS/TS + React veteran) with a passion for smashing bugs who is also native to the crypto space. You can write and speak fluent English and have great communication skills.
 
You love debugging, you like doing detective work to figure out the cause of the problem and ultimately resolving it. 
 
You have experience and are culturally aligned with fast-moving small teams. You have worked at remote (globally distributed) startups before.
 
You are self-driven, are comfortable wearing many hats, can ship patches and features swiftly when needed. You can identify company priorities, own them, and iterate quickly to ship the best solution.
 
The Role:
 
Senior engineers are expected to take big complex tasks single-handedly. 
 
As a Senior frontend + QA engineer you will be the bridge between bug reporting and bug termination. You will manage several communication channels as well as our bug reporting process to make sure all QA tasks are correctly prioritized and executed. 
 
You will work closely with both the Front-end team and the QA team to help build and maintain react components, as well as helping shape our automated testing pipelines.
 
Responsibilities
As a Web3 Architect you will:
-Create and document automated and manual test plans and procedures
-Configure and set up testing environments
-Implement, run, and monitor automated tests
-Write scripts in the language of your choice that can help us improve the QA process
-Onboard new individuals into the Web3 Architecture team
-Mentor team members to refine their technical and architectural skills
-Build, test, and ship features, patches, and updates to our web app
-Collaborate with the team and cross-functional partners on all aspects of product development
-Identify and advocate for team-wide areas of improvement and best practices
 
Requirements
-At least 3 years with JS/TS + React
-At least 3 years of TDD with extensive experience in designing manual tests
-Extensive experience with CSS libraries (MUI preferred)
-Outstanding communication skills
-Some experience with crypto is required
-Fluency with different operating systems (Linux, MacOS etc.)
-Experience with multiple browsers (Brave, Firefox, Safari, Chrome)
-(Nice to have) Experience with web wallets such as Metamask and WalletConnect
-(Nice to have) Experience with ethers.js or web3.js libraries
-(Nice to have) Experience with CI/CD tools (Github Actions preferred)
-(Nice to have) Experience with automation tools (Playwright preferred)
-(Nice to have) Experience with Discord and Discord web hooks.
Benefits
Work from anywhere (Remote first), Flexible working hours, Flexible vacation policy, Competitive Salary + Token bonus (portion or all can be paid in Crypto).  Premia is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
 
Premia welcomes all qualified persons to apply. Compensation will be competitive and commensurate with experience. This is a full time role.
 
To find out more you can view their website at https://premia.finance/

results.title: Senior Penetration Tester
results.description:
Triskele labs are looking for a Senior Penetration Tester to join our team, this role may be based in Australia, New Zealand, UK or USA.

As a member of the Triskele Labs Penetration Testing team, you will have a sound knowledge of the Information Securityindustry, in particular Penetration Testing practices. Penetration Testers conduct Penetration Testing of client assets, networks, applications, and infrastructure, to identify vulnerabilities and security flaws within the scope of an engagement. The Penetration Tester will then detail any such issues once identified within a detailed report, accurately identifying and describing their potential impact and technical complexity in tandem with recommendations to mitigate the issue.

The Penetration Tester will conduct Penetration Tests of the following types:

  • Web Applications
  • Mobile Applications
  • External Infrastructure
  • Internal Infrastructure

You will fluently operate software to conduct the above penetration testing activities, including but not limiting to:

  • Web application proxy (i.e. BurpSuite)
  • Scanners, such as Nessus, web application scanners and open source tools
  • Directory brute forcing tools
  • Encryption configuration verification
  • Response header identification
  • Tools specific to a web technology, i.e. ASP.NET, PHP, Java, etc

You will maintain and respond to all client communications in a timely fashion during an engagement, including answering standard and basic questions, taking phone calls, sending daily start and end emails, and more. In addition, you will review peer reports for engagements and provide succinct, considered feedback to improve the quality of the report and ensure the report is completed to the expected quality standard prior to passing the report to the Penetration Testing Team Lead for final review.

Requirements

Triskele Labs provide bespoke services to our clients, which makes us unique. We are not only looking for technical brilliant Penetration Testers, but also those with excellent soft skills. Aside from these technical skills, you will posses:

  • OSCP Mandatory
  • OSWE preferable
  • CREST Registered Tester (CRT) preferable
  • Demonstrated experience as a Penetration Tester, in particular focusing on Web Applications
  • Excellent English Skills
  • Ability to work with clients during testing

Benefits

Team culture is everything to Triskele Labs and it is the reason we exist. Our founder set out to create a cybersecurity company that is a place our team love to work. While we focus this culture on the team in Australia, the pivot to remote working has ensured that we provide this for all team members, on-site or remote. We will continue to strive for excellence with our inclusive team culture through initiatives developed by our People and Culture team. In addition, we provide:

  • Annual Training Budget and Paid Training Leave
  • Paid Secondary Care Giver Leave (up to 12 weeks post 12 months of service)
  • Additional days of leave - 'Birthday Leave' and 'Doona Day'
  • Continual Learning Scenarios through team knowledge sharing
  • Access to Employee Assistance Program (EAP) for all team members
  • Social functions organised by our People & Culture Team
  • Choice of laptop when starting (up to $5k machine)
  • Above Market Salary
  • Monthly "Hack Day"
  • Keep your personally developed tools should you leave
  • Keep any bounties you receive through submissions during an engagement

We are a forward thinking company and always looking for ways to boost our team culture and ensure we are a destination employer.

results.title: QA Automation Engineer
results.description:
coherence is a tech startup in the games industry, working on leveling the playing field for multiplayer games. We are making a network engine and platform that allows any developer to easily create anything from a simple multiplayer game to a large, cloud-based virtual world. Read more about coherence here.

We are looking for an experienced QA Automation engineer with a real passion for testing and automation that ensures the quality of our product.

Become part of our engineering team and help us democratize multiplayer game development. As a QA Automation engineer, you will develop scalable automated testing strategies for functional, regression and performance testing. The goal of this role is to improve and sustain the overall quality of the product, including stability, reliability and performance.

You will write integration tests, create and integrate test and validation tools to make QA an integral part of the product development cycle. You will design, develop, implement and maintain test procedures, automated tests, acceptance tests and establish quality goals for all aspects and components of coherence.

 
Responsibilities
  • Work with engineers to identify functional, end-to-end, regression, load and performance testing requirements.
  • Create and maintain unit and integration tests for all product components.
  • Design, build and maintain testing tools, automation frameworks and QA pipelines.
  • Analyze product customer reports and feedback and translate them into comprehensive test cases.
  • Drive testing automation, deliver technical solutions and identify opportunities to increase test effectiveness and coverage.
  • Implement quality metrics, analyze test and performance data and results to identify and communicate risk and quality status

Requirements

  • 5+ years of professional experience as a QA engineer.
  • Strong programming skills.
  • Experience with test automation and automation frameworks.
  • Experience with and knowledge of Unity and C#.
  • Experience with and knowledge of CI/CD with GitHub.
  • Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes.
  • Love for high quality and attention to detail, a problem-solving mindset, positive attitude and openness to feedback.
 
Bonus points
  • Game development experience in Unity.
  • Demonstrated ability to work well with a globally distributed team.
  • Passion for games.

 

We kindly request that you only apply for this role if you are within the UTC-7 to UTC+2 time zones as we will not be able to consider your application otherwise.

results.title: QA Engineer
results.description:
At Expero, we build complex software in challenging domains for expert users; scientists, traders and engineers. These are not your normal applications and our consultants work across a spectrum of technologies from graph databases, enterprise infrastructure to reactive web applications on the front end. Expero has its own design and UX team who create rich, interactive experiences around the apps that we build.

Expero’s main base is in Houston & Austin, Texas but we’re a remote friendly company with teams spread around the US and developers in the Canary Islands, Argentina, and Romania.

We're looking for a QA Engineer that enjoys building frameworks that move towards 100% automated testing of complex applications. Testing fast, complex systems serving a plethora of requests are some of the types of challenges you'll face. Finding innovative solutions to test large and small applications is what gets your quality assurance juices going. Our applications are deployed across various environments, from monolithic frameworks to microservices. We're looking for people that thrive under these types of conditions. If this sounds like you, then we're interested in finding out more about you.

Requirements

Ideally, you have experience with most of these

  • Automation testing
  • Cypress, Mocha, Jest, Jenkins
  • Establishing test frameworks and best practices in testing
  • Writing scripts, test plans, test cases
  • Set patterns and design
  • Languages/Scripting: Python, Node.js, Bash, Shell, etc.
  • Clear and repeatable test documentation writing
  • Troubleshoot test failures in the test environments: various databases, web server and application server logs, code reviews, UAT, regression
  • Black-box, grey-box, white-box

Benefits

We get better work done for our clients when all our employees are paid well and have excellent benefits, including group health, dental, and life insurance, family leave, and a retirement plan. So that’s the way we do it.

Expero is committed to being an equal opportunity employer. Our focus is solving challenging problems, not where you came from or how you live your life. We are an E-Verify workplace.

results.title: QA Technical Support Specialist
results.description:
QA Technical Support Specialist

The Quality Assurance (QA) Specialist is a new role expected to build a first-in-class service that fuels innovation by enabling the delivery of high-quality, reliable software and platforms for our client's customized projects. You'll be responsible for building and executing QA plans involving applications of VR, AR and future hardware platforms. You will work with the development teams to analyze and report on defects and performance, and triage feedback for responses. You will also analyze user sentiment in partnership with multiple product groups to identify improvements to our custom solutions and projects.

The ideal candidate is a detail-oriented tech enthusiast with experience working with software development teams shipping great software running on consumer electronics products and utilizing user insights to improve product iterations. You are methodical, a self-starter, meticulous about quality and have a user-oriented mindset. A successful QA Technical Support Specialist will develop and maintain healthy relationships with team members, customers, and internal stakeholders. They will also be an internal expert on adopting upcoming technology and identifying test parameters to assure reliability and usability in an enterprise setting.

Minimum Qualifications

  • 5+ years testing experience on VR, AR, or current game consoles and a resulting strong understanding of the software test process with products utilizing 3D graphics
  • Experience creating/updating application Test Plans and User Acceptance Tests
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience analyzing and interpreting data, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, and reporting results across stakeholders
  • Experience going through a full product lifecycle, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritization and pre/post-launch execution

Responsibilities

  • Implement process changes to implement and scale QA and testing efforts across multiple products & teams
  • Partner with internal first-party product development teams, develop and execute both small to large-scale beta testing and dogfooding programs that provide coverage for multiple platforms
  • Funnel learnings back to the development teams in a consistent and digestible manner to continuously improve products
  • Partner with QA test teams to integrate learnings into structured test strategies and execution
  • Identify, test, track and report KPI and user-experience trends over the course of the projects
  • Diagnose issues, report defects, and propose A/B tests to discover reoccurrences
  • Establish and implement group-wide defect tracking and reporting system
  • Work with engineers and project leads to triage and prioritize issues for resolution
  • Own the process of creating metrics to measure and monitor product performance
  • Frequently identify significant product, organizational, and process opportunities and drive them to fruition often without explicit direction and resourcing
  • Maximize efficiency in a constantly evolving environment where the process is fluid and creative solutions are the norm

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience building or leading a dogfooding-service for first party products
  • Scripting or coding experience
  • Experience with XR: Virtual Reality, Augmented Reality, Mixed Reality or Spatial Computing technology
  • Experience building a service from scratch
